basics.name: Richard Hendriks
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary: Richard hails from Tulsa. He has earned degrees from the University of Oklahoma and Stanford. (Go Sooners and Cardinal!) Before starting Pied Piper, he worked for Hooli as a part time software developer. While his work focuses on applied information theory, mostly optimizing lossless compression schema of both the length-limited and adaptive variants, his non-work interests range widely, everything from quantum computing to chaos theory. He could tell you about it, but THAT would NOT be a “length-limited” conversation!

work.name: Pied Piper
work.summary: Pied Piper is a multi-platform technology based on a proprietary universal compression algorithm that has consistently fielded high Weisman Scores™ that are not merely competitive, but approach the theoretical limit of lossless compression.
highlights: Build an algorithm for artist to detect if their music was violating copy right infringement laws
Optimized an algorithm that holds the current world record for Weisman Scores

volunteer.summary: Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.

publications.name: Video compression for 3d media
publications.summary: Innovative middle-out compression algorithm that changes the way we store data.

references.name: Erlich Bachman
references.reference: It is my pleasure to recommend Richard, his performance working as a consultant for Main St. Company proved that he will be a valuable addition to any company.

projects.name: StarGazer
projects.description: An interactive mobile app that uses augmented reality to educate users about constellations, planets, and celestial events. Point your device at the sky, and StarGazer identifies and provides information about the stars and planets you see.

projects.name: EcoChef
projects.description: An app that generates recipes based on leftovers in your fridge to reduce food waste. Users can input their available ingredients, and the app will suggest creative and delicious recipes.

projects.name: TimeHopper
projects.description: A virtual reality experience that allows users to witness historical events as if they were there. This educational tool immerses users in different eras, offering a unique way to learn history.

projects.name: Fitness Quest
projects.description: An interactive game that turns daily fitness routines into an adventure. Users complete challenges, track their progress, and unlock achievements while improving their physical health.

projects.name: SafeSpace
projects.description: An online platform that provides mental health support through anonymous chat rooms moderated by certified therapists. It's a safe place for people to discuss their issues and seek guidance.

projects.name: GreenThumb
projects.description: An app for gardening enthusiasts that offers personalized advice on plant care, pest control, and seasonal gardening tips. It includes a community feature for users to share experiences and advice.
